meaningMnemonic:
A <kanji>lively</kanji> <kanji>leap</kanji> is what you do when you have <vocabulary>active participation</vocabulary> in an <vocabulary>activity</vocabulary> and often find <vocabulary>success</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>do great</vocabulary>.

This word is usually used to describe someone’s outstanding or remarkable activity in a certain sport, career, or other field or activity. Have a look at the common word combinations for some example usages.</vocabulary>
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own.
